intro: Iberis ciliata var. vestita, commonly known as the velvet candytuft, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features dense clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has silvery-gray foliage covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long blooming period.
